title: Client Metrics - Associate Information Technology Analyst
tagsAndSkills: Power Bi,Microsoft Power Bi,bi analyst,Ms Power Bi,power bi consultant,Bi Development,Power Platform,microsoft business intelligence

ambitionBoxData.Title: The Dow Chemical Company Reviews by Employees

jobDescription:
Job Description:

Dow has an exciting opportunity for a Business Readiness Associate Information Technology Analyst located in Mumbai India! This position is in the Enterprise Delivery Organization with the role aligning to Business Readiness tower with primary expertise in Client Metrics.

About you

As the Business Readiness Associate Information Technology Analyst, you will apply conceptual knowledge to assist in utilizing a variety of data analysis tools to track, monitor, and assess business processes to provide transparency of progress towards a desired objective. Accompanied by Business Readiness guidance, acting as a voice for business resources in details related to enabling new or changing infrastructure, work processes, or systems capabilities during implementation projects by applying general knowledge of Information Systems.

Also, you can complete each of the following tasks:

  • Collaboration with leadership to develop a portal where all reports within the organization can be easily accessed and utilized, along with mobile capabilities
  • Creation of new metrics to assist with transparency among the organization, leading to higher client satisfaction
  • Comprehensive reporting throughout project life cycle, ensuring end to end transparency
  • Coordinate the reporting of end users involved in testing, requiring training, and requiring changes to security profiles
  • Develop client metric reports using MET (currently primarily Power BI) based on project requirements
  • Understand key Business stakeholders' needs and deliver metrics that tell the story to meet their needs

Required qualifications:

  • Bachelors degree in computer science, Information Technology or similar education.
  • A minimum 3 years of relevant work experience.
  • Power BI development experience.
  • Data analysis experience

Your preferred qualifications:

  • A degree discipline in Computer Science, Information Systems or other technical field
  • Experience in system design, implementation and support
  • Experience in software engineering / programming experience
  • Project Management knowledge is beneficial
  • DevOps experience

Your skills, knowledge, and abilities include:

  • Ability to work successfully in a team being a team player
  • Ability to work with global teams in different time-zones.
  • Excellent written and oral communication Skills

Additional notes

-Relocation assistance is not available


Please use the link below to apply for this position:-

https://corporate.dow.com/en-us/careers/jobs/position.R2053502.html ?source=NaukriEMEAI

title: Associate Service Manager
tagsAndSkills: Agile Methodology,Scrum Master,Servicenow Development,Certified Scrum Master,workflows,integrations,ITIL v4 certification,Workflow

ambitionBoxData.Title: The Dow Chemical Company Reviews by Employees

jobDescription:
About this role

As an Associate Service Manager, We are seeking a skilled and detail-oriented Scrum Master/Service Compliance Manager for our Information Security Services (ISS) team. As a Scrum Master for ISS DevOps, you will be responsible for facilitating the agile development process and ensuring the delivery of high-quality software solutions. You will work closely with developers which may be developing code, low code, or no code solutions. ServiceNow development will be a sizable percentage of the DevOps work and thus you will work closely with ServiceNow developers, module owners, catalog practitioners, technical architects, and the team leader to plan, execute, and review sprints. You will also monitor and report on the progress, performance, and quality of the ServiceNow development team. As the Service Compliance Manager, you will help advance ITIL principles within the ISS team. Key ServiceNow deliverables include facilitating the development of service descriptions, service catalogs, KPIs, knowledge management and service roadmaps.

Responsibilities

  • Manage sprints by defining the scope, goals, and deliverables of each sprint, and ensuring that the developers have clear and complete descriptions of the requests.
  • Coordinate and facilitate meetings to look ahead and look back at the sprint, and to resolve any issues or impediments that arise during the development process.
  • Communicate and collaborate with the module owners, catalog practitioners, technical architects, and the team leader to align the expectations, requirements, and feedback of the stakeholders.
  • Track and measure the workload, velocity, and quality of the developers, and provide regular reports and feedback to the team and to management.
  • Lead and manage the development and delivery of ServiceNow solutions for ISS.
  • Promote and uphold the agile principles and values, and foster a culture of continuous improvement, collaboration, and innovation within the development team.
  • Assist Service Managers with defining and maturing their security services and practices. Help ensure the services teams have the necessary skills training. Help teams develop service catalogs and facilitate the DevOps lifecycle. Help teams define the appropriate KPIs to adequately manage their services.

Qualifications

  • Bachelor's degree in computer science, engineering, or related field, or equivalent work experience.
  • At least 3 years of experience as a Scrum Master or a similar role in software development, preferably in a ServiceNow environment.
  • Overall IT experience of 7+ years
  • Certified Scrum Master (CSM) or equivalent certification.
  • Strong knowledge of ServiceNow development, including custom applications, workflows, and integrations.

Preferred Skills

  • Strong knowledge and experience of agile methodologies, tools, and best practices.
  • Excellent communication, facilitation, and interpersonal skills.
  • Ability to work effectively with diverse, international, and cross-functional teams.
  • Problem-solving, analytical, and organizational skills.
  • ITIL v4 certification is a plus.

Additional notes

  • Relocation assistance is not available with this position.
  • The ability to accommodate a flexible schedule aligned with international time zones is essential.

Please apply on the below link :-

https://corporate.dow.com/en-us/careers/jobs/position.R2052488.html ?source=NaukriEMEAI

title: Hiring!!! HSE Manager - Jamnagar - Reliance Industries (RIL)
tagsAndSkills: HSE Management,Safety Management,HSE,Safety Audit,EHS,OHSAS 18001,Industrial Safety,Osha
jobDescription:
Responsibilities:

1. Policy Implementation and Monitoring:

- Assist in developing and implementing HSE policies and practices.

- Devise strategies to achieve targets and promote best practices.

- Establish tools and systems for monitoring performance and implementing strategies.


2. Documentation and Reporting:

- Prepare and maintain HSE Management documentation.

- Implement SOPs, conduct HSE audits, and report findings to management.

- Ensure full compliance of HSE&F function with the QMS (ISO -9001) System.


3. Safety and Health:

- Promote a safety mindset during Project/O&M phases, ensuring 100% PPE usage.

- Collaborate with Project/O&M Incharge for contractor resource Management from safety perspective and statutory compliance.

- Implement OSHAS, HIRA, LOTO, etc.

- Develop and implement emergency preparedness & response planning.

- Establish Safety Audit mechanism and conduct Safety Audits.


4. Compliance and Training:

- Develop HSE Training Modules for Own and contractor Employees.

- Conduct HSE training for employees and Contractor Employees.

- Liaise with government authorities, address complaints, and ensure compliance.

- Develop and implement Waste Management Policy and Plan.

- Handle and investigate non-conformities, taking actions to mitigate impacts, and completing corrective/preventive actions.


5. Projects and Support:

- Prepare HSE Budget for Capex Project/Opex.

- Support Engineering team in designing Safety Gadgets as per National/International Standards.

- Assist the Project/O&M Team on all EHS issues.


6. Safety Facilitation:

- Assist Project/O&M departments in planning and organizing measures for effective injury control.

- Evaluate the effectiveness of actions taken to prevent personal injuries.

- Organize HSEF Promotional activities such as National Safety Day, Road Safety Week, and R&R Programs.


7. Accident Investigation:

- Provide guidance on reporting and investigation of industrial accidents and occupational diseases.

- Investigate all accidents and near-miss incidents.
